lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (slurred) We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to have Laura Bailey joining us as soon as she comes in. She's coming in hot from work, but she'll be here soon enough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excellent mime work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If worse comes to worst, Taliesin will obviously fill in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (high-pitched voice) Hey! Hey guys! Oh god, let her never see that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's in traffic watching right now going, "I'm going to fucking kill him." Hi, Laura! Before we get into tonight's episode, let's get through our announcements for the evening. First off, we have two wonderful sponsors tonight, beginning with our first sponsor, our continuing relationship with our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: D&D Beyond!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it was going to be great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Y'all going to hype me to death?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was going to be pretty epic, but she's not here, so I can't do it. I wrote another thing. I thought, tonight, I could go to the D&D Beyond webpage on my iPad here and read some stuff off of their FAQ or their About Us because I don't have anything planned. I'm going to go to my browser right now. This is going to be fine! I was just there earlier today, so I'll fire it up. Okay, here it is. FurryDate is a matchmaking website for the furry community. If you're looking for a furry friend-- that is not-- that must have been another site that wound up on my browser somehow. I will go further back in the history a little bit. Oh! Oh boy, that's a lot of skin. I think this site might be called Double D Beyond. Okay, it's a lot of pop-ups. I'll click on Install on all of them to make them go away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Family show. Family show, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to get back in the history to the website.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you been on YouTube since 2007?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just got to something. Apparently I owe the IRS some money, and I have to go to Target to buy a gift card to send it to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think that's real. I think that's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Check them out. Show them the Critter love. Wish them a merry Christmas with the hashtag #BrianFosterSmellsLikeCabbage. That's all I got.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beautiful. Maybe erase your browser history.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think I can because I've lost control of this whole thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is a company laptop. Pointing that out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're fired.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Phew, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, imagine more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Matt, why do you make things so evil?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We announced at our State of the Role, on our channel, we have a bunch of new shows like Pub Draw with Babs Tarr. MAME Drop we've continued into a show that's coming out in the new year, in which we play a bunch of random games on the MAME Cabinet you got to see built as part of All Work No Play! Check out details on those upcoming shows at critrole.com. This is our last episode of Critical Role of 2018, folks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man, how did that happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, it's nuts. The campaign's gone a year.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No one die in the last one of 2018. Don't die!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But then you'd have so much time to come up with a new character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is true. If there was a night to do it, this is the time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're closing in on four years.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What? No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's insane.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct. Almost four years of D&D here. Hmm. Feels good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We look forward to seeing you then. Also, be sure to tune in Tuesday, January 8th, 2019 for a very special, campaign-as-it-currently-lies Talks Machina, where most of the cast will be there to discuss things that have happened, questions they may have. I won't answer most of them because I'm a dick. It's going to be fun! We're going to discuss all things that have happened and answer your guys' questions. Make sure you don't miss that on January 8th at 7:00pm Pacific. Also, tomorrow night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tomorrow night!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So to prepare you right for the Christmas holiday, or far after any holidays you may be celebrating, or anything in between, whatever it may be, this is going to be a fun one-shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was a thing. It was very special.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a lot of fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, stuff went down. So enjoy. It was a wonderful way to kick off the holiday. Unless I am mistaken, that is the last of our announcements.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, friends, let's jump into tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Critical Role! [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're about to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Diggin' deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. Last we left off, The Mighty Nein had been making their way through the Swavain Islands in the Lucidian Ocean after vanishing from the island of Darktow with the damaged Squalleater, renaming it the Balleater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As you do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had acquired another sphere of Uk'otoa--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (whispering) Uk'otoa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Uk'otoa? (parrot caw)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who brought a fucking parrot? Damn it, Jester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Upon making your way to the Bisaft Isle to get repairs for your ship as it limps along the ocean, you discovered that you had a stowaway who had followed you on the ship since Darktow. The delightful gnome named Twiggy befriended you and revealed the item which had sent her on her path to becoming a stowaway, the strange clockwork arcane sphere that she seemed to have stolen from an auction house to keep away from a bad man. Upon toying with this sphere, you discovered that it seemed to have some sort of planar elements, bits of conjuration magic to it, and was dispensing coins and cold weather attire. A little more tweaking sent you somewhere else. The present party was transported to some extra-planar dungeon, if you will, an abode of a hundred plus rooms that apparently belonged to a mage from long ago. Upon exploring and making your way through the various traps and tricks, you managed to avoid a few pitfalls, trigger a few others, gather a few objects, fight a cabinet, find some books, and end up teleported in a scattered fashion into the realm of a young blue dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A lot happened real fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Mighty Nein, as you are still at dock on Bisaft Isle, what would you like to do the following morning?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I was going to ask. What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's say it's a long night's sleep, because there's a lot of recovery. So I'll say, without any sort of necessary reference to wake you up for an early point, you sleep in till near noon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perfect timing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, guys!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Hi, Laura!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now we're complete.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mostly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We just started and we slept in all the way till noon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that would be really nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can take your backpack off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I suppose we should mosey out and get the lay of the land, as it were.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, Wilford Brimley.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know why I'm like this. I slept real heavy, mm-kay? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we should go walk around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could use some solid land. That'd be nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whose donut is this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's mine; this one's yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet! Keep going, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that says: This is Laura's; don't fucking touch-- LAURA I didn't know there was a donut in there; it just said Don't Touch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else could it be?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before dinner?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (mouth full) Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To be fair, that's one of the perks of being an adult.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. Caleb, did you want to maybe look at some books before we leave?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know anything about this island? Is it large?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know a little bit. You've passed here once or twice. It's the largest of a set of four parallel islands, but for the most part, it's not really cultivated. The jungles here are fairly thick. The fruit trees and exotic creatures make it an interesting pass-by port, but also a dangerous thing to push into. The thick mangrove trees choke most of the coastal areas except for on the south, which is where the actual town of Bisaft Port is, which is where you guys are currently set. You do know that, because it's cluttered, it tends to be a favorite spot for contraband out in the jungle, but the creatures that live there are pretty dangerous, so most people avoid that. There are some remaining signs of the Ki'Nau people that used to be indigenous to these islands before they all became part of the Clovis Concord. That's about all you know. I mean, it's a small village, maybe 800 people or so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll relay all that stuff in my own tongue and say: I'm sure there's stuff. It grows a little bit each time I come by here, so there could be new stuff I haven't seen before. Worth a look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm. I think that I will stay behind on the boat but I think you should go. If you see any incense, I would appreciate it if you picked some up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to just stay? Are you going to go look through the stuff that we got?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, probably. Ja.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want me to stay with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (clears throat)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well at the very least, maybe you should have Nott try and open some of those funny locks on the books before we go so that you have an easier time getting into them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we not open them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think we opened the individual locks on the books. I think you just grabbed locked books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Part of the locking mechanism was embedded in the shelf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think I actually will be all right, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! And I grab this one, too. There was one more that you didn't get to see.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Thank you! Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what it is. I just picked it up. Seemed like the thing to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, anytime.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about paper? Aren't you always needing papier?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't get the sense that a lot of high-quality paper and ink makes it to this island, but I have been wrong before, so if you see any would you bring some back and I will reimburse you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, of course!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to take it easy today.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, fair enough. Where's Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm coming downstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Downstairs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Downstairs from my upstairs cabin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's just one above-deck cabin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I slept in the crow's nest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How are you doing this morning, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (heavy sigh) I'm okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to go out and explore a little bit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you okay? I know the day's escapades were a bit much. Little close.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a lot, yes. You disappeared, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, well you did, too. Every time I popped into wherever I was, I could see you pop in and then pop out and I kept wanting to go make sure you knew we were getting the fuck out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. In the dragon room, too. I was talking about in the library, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just touched it. Like, you know. Didn't know if it was rough or smooth or cold. Didn't expect to be like (glass shattering) ah! None of that shit. Boop!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I won't do that so much anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes you just need to touch things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! What are you grinning at, goblin?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing. You have a compulsion. I just think it's funny.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are a bit handsy sometimes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we not all intrigued by things that don't belong or seem out of place?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but you know, I don't offer a lot of muscle to this group but I do have a little bit of knowledge. So, you know, in situations like that just give me a moment to have a look around the room, please, Fjord. Yes, thank you, Beauregard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, that's fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, it's hard because I do pretty reckless things. I don't know. I honestly feel like everyone feels terrible about how that went, but you know, when you look at on the whole, we did okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Twiggy said that the dragon is actually dead now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I believe her, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't even ask. What was in the room before I got ripped out of there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lots of books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Angry furniture.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. A cabinet swallowed Nott, no, Twiggy. It all kind of ran together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A lot happened.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lot of books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a doll, there were some marbles, dust, a lot of books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, we got a thing of marbles and a thing of ink.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh, did you get the marbles and the ink? That's nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute. When I disappeared, you didn't immediately come and try and find me? You went and got stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did. Beau did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, we were trying to figure out what had happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb and I knew where you were and wanted to ascertain...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Honestly man, when you did that you were totally alone and by yourself. It took us a minute to figure out what exactly had happened and what you touched.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, maybe you were locked behind something or there was some way to release it in the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You left us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My mother was a big believer in the buddy system. Growing up in the woods, buddy system. Always should have a buddy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we all have a buddy? Should we call these now? I call Caleb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well I just wanted to make sure that I got Caleb, but you guys, maybe you should buddy up for future encounters.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about I just keep my hands in my pockets going forward into strange new rooms by long-dead wizards, potentially.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good luck. You can't fight a compulsion, man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You would know, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know. Get that itch. Got to scratch it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I got a button around here somewhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope you know, my intention wasn't to abandon anybody, especially not you. I thought I was going to have to activate the damn sphere and it was going to open up a portal or something. I didn't know it was going to immediately take me away from the fight. I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course! Really, I was invisible, you guys. I wasn't there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're all still friends?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, okay. Oh, I see this, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You were in a wall, dude.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was in a wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's pretty cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I think that everybody here thinks that this is their fault. Raise your hand if you think what happened yesterday was your fault.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I might have a part in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, partially. If I'd have done better against the dragon--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't do anything wrong!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do I roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Insight, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't need an insight check. I believe it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think I did anything wrong!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I usually find that if everybody thinks that they're the ones that did something wrong, it's because nobody did everything wrong. You just had a string of luck. I think everybody did really good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree with that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that we all got out of there. I think that we all tried our best and we're going to do better next time. I'm feeling very positive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a great pep talk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Need that uplifting-- yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You survived a dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, we're giving you a hard time, but there was no reason why I needed to keep fiddling with this thing, and I pat the satchel that I have the ball in. Could have left it well enough alone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I appreciate that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You took a risk. Risks are okay. Got to be careful what risks you take, but without risks, we're never going to get what we want.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good point. What do we want?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I think we want breakfast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Get off this godforsaken boat for a damn minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then we can have a talk about that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a great idea. In fact, you should lead the way. I have a feeling you'll be able to find the best spot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent. I don't actually even know how to get off this boat. We haven't done it properly in so long.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First mate, show them how!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Do I show them how? Am I first mate-y enough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've learned enough, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll for first mate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know where the fucking exit is? Because I might not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have proficiency bonus. Okay, so you guys head back up to the deck and over towards the dock. Couple of things you notice. One, you haven't really been out of the ship to see the port. By the time you guys returned it was nighttime and didn't have, really, a good view, as at night on this island, there really isn't a lot of light; it shuts down at dusk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're talking about Bisaft?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bisaft. There's a lot of ships. Probably about 20 or so. They're mainly Concord military vessels, similar to the one you saw and avoided on the outskirts of Nicodranas. Glancing over, there are a few groups of soldiers on the docks stretching. Looks like they're loading supplies into the ships. They're making a stop and the ships are waiting for others to fill up because it's a small dock. It's mainly meant to maintain, at most, six or seven ships at a time, so they're having to go in waves to take supplies and they're probably cleaning out some of what Bisaft Port has.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As we make our way by, can I identify a low-ranking member of one of the crewmen of one of those ships as they're, perhaps, reaching for a bundle or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, yeah. There's a number you can go ahead and stop. There's one of them nearby that is sitting there stretching legs and gathering their supplies in a small sack. They probably bought a few things to take on the path.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You there! By gods, you guys are stocking up something fierce!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, we are making our way through the waters. This is just a quick stop."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Amazing. Do you mind if I ask where all this traffic is going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, with the recent attacks, the war at the Empire, it's getting a little hairy, so the "Marquis Olesya Lapidus is calling many of the warships to the southern coast to be a precaution "near the border."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I understand. I'm sorry to hear it's moving so aggressively. Are you concerned, or do you feel strength in your numbers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What I have heard," and he leans in a bit, "is the underelves apparently snuck past the mountain "range and attacked further inland. Felderwin was assaulted and the fields were set ablaze."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, where was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A smart move in cutting the food from the people, eh? These beasts are clever. Be careful."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said Felderwin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Felderwin, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Just in case our travels take us in your direction, is there any particular route or island that we should avoid just to stay out of your hair?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think-- We are running along the coast and just heading to the southern area south "of the jungles and a little bit past Nicodranas and keeping a boundary in the waters."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That should be far away from where we're heading. I wish you a safe journey, my friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You as well." He grabs his stuff and throws it over his shoulder and heads back to the rest of the crew.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, the Xhorhasians snuck under the mountains and attacked Felderwin?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's where they attacked, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's deep in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You passed by Felderwin when you were traveling both north and south on that road there and it's a heavy source of agriculture. In fact, it feeds a lot of the military.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we might return to a different empire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ask them where they're from, all the troops. Did you already ask that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're from outside Nicodranas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So they won't know who we are?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus, we got a new boat, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You turn around and you see a human male in his mid-40s with salt and pepper brown hair with a thick mustache, somewhat stained linen clothing with a length of rope wrapped over his shoulder, and he goes, "Hello, I'm Dockmaster Podderan. I was "the one patiently waiting, I guess, for you all to return and pay for the good repairs that were "required of my crew. So if you want to pay up, or we're going to have to keep the Balleater ourselves."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, indeed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Curious name, Balleater, by the way."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have every intention of paying. I just haven't received the bill from my first mate yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I frantically search for a bill that I probably don't have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You definitely don't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at the dockmaster; I go: Give me the bill.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reaches into his satchel, pulls out a small leather ledger, past a few pages. There's little counts, a couple notes there. Tears it out and hands it to you. It's for 225 gold for full ship repairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's more than they said when we came out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take care of it. I'm the one touching little red things. 295?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're taking care of all of it? Did we have any--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: His Grog is showing. Was there any money left on the ship from Avantika?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. That pot was taken by Darktow when they came aboard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, when they came and cleaned it out after the fucking razzle-dazzle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So all the money we have is pretty much the money we have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. That was the other downside with Avantika being wrapped up in this whole plot in Darktow was, as soon as she was executed, they commandeered anything that belonged to her crew and left you guys the ship. With the supplies on the ship: you got to keep the cannons, the cannonballs, the gunpowder, basic supplies that were left over for survival and upkeep, but anything of worth was taken by Darktow as their prize.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to need to wash some dishes, aren't we?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I cut my gold in half, holy shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We might want to consider having a communal ship fund. We'll talk about it later.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here is your 225 gold. Thank you for your careful inspection and repair of the ship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Appreciate that. All right, well, when're you planning to head off?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, in the next day or two, we're just getting our bearings about us again. We'll be out of your hair shortly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Could you leave possibly by end of day? I'll give you back 30 gold if that's the case. I "need to--," and he looks off towards the ships that are waiting and goes, "I kind of need the space."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would love to tell you yes, friend, but the best I could do is let you know before sundown.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe for 50 gold we could get out, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have stuff we have to do, don't rush us out of here!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's not very good. Eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Well, come find me," and he points over to one of the nicer coastal huts set up right at the outside of the docks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, nice. Yeah, we'll find you. I promise we'll be as expedient as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right." Turns back and heads off to his business. Various military crews are still running up and down the docks carrying supplies to and from. What would you guys like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Walk inland.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Breakfast! Caduceus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and eyes up as we pass things along the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm walking towards where I think breakfast is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, you're a foodie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20! I was really looking forward to having no idea, but apparently--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got to make more of a fuss about that, that's pretty cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold on, I got Yelp. I cast Yelp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The closest place-- the scent catches your nose. There's a place called the Bisaft Meadery.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Meatery?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meadery.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Meadery.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's better. I was like: Mm, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It's a small, open-- It looks like a simple tavern, but only the back half of it has walls where it's a thatched top. There are support beams, and there are a number of tables and stools set up and a number of mead barrels set up in the back as well as an open grill made of metal rods welded over each other and a bunch of wood burning beneath it. Some of the people that live here in Bisaft that run this meadery are preparing an open breakfast, essentially, and a lot of the soldiers are crowding over and filling up spaces. The scent catches your nose of cooking boar and various fruits and vegetables that are also being mixed in, giving you this sweet meat scent that hits you as you're stepping off the dock. The closer you get, you realize you've got to get there pretty quickly because it's starting to fill up with a lot of these soldiers. As you get to the food, it smells delicious. It's made for a mass meal for the number of people that are here, so this is their way of preparing as much as they can, so it's nothing meticulous. It's nothing gourmet, necessarily, but it looks delicious and it looks serviceable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can pick around the boar; that shouldn't be a problem.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't eat boar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't eat boar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you eat meat?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't eat meat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have you not noticed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I haven't!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh. Yeah, no. I mean, we've barely cooked with any of it in the last month.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But meat tastes very, very good!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just assumed you were conjuring, you know, sea pigeons and stuff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's mostly seitan. There's a few different things I use. You can really get an effect, it's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seitan?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Mickey Mouse voice) Hail, seitan!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Making me call my vegan cooking not legit. My god, I'm mad right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quinn-wah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A lot of beets. I'm excited for this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we relatively free of furtive glances as we make our way through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, due to the nature of this being a small port and the military that are coming in through here. People live here from all over; you can see a spectrum of skin tones that lead you to believe that there are people both who come from the Ki'Nau, who are from the island, people that have settled from the Empire, folks that have come from Marquet and come here and even probably is a few super pale folks here that may have found their way over from Issylra. For the people that live here, it's a fairly diverse cultural capital, though a lot of it seems to be mostly ingrained, at least the basis of it, in the Ki'Nau people and the base of a lot of the Menagerie Coast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, can I make you a plate?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I think I'm okay, Fjord, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, cool. Should we bring Caleb some food?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes, we should. I can take him some in my pockets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pocket boar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pocket bacon, pocket boar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try some mead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some mead, not meat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not meat. But I am going to try some mead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, how much is a bottle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How can I help you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think he wanted to try some mead, I wanted to try some mead, and then we wanted to buy some mead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I can help with any of these, of course."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your name?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beau. Well, a pleasure to meet you. I am Bentha Tamalos, and welcome to my meadery."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Benth-- can I call you Ben?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Call me Bentha, please."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bentha. Pleasure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, how many bottles would you like? Do you want "to have glasses separately or do you want to just buy bottles and serve yourselves?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It smells really sweet. What's the sweetest thing you've got right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it's all pretty sweet. It's all brewed here with our island-cultivated honeybees."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's sweet, you'll like it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just get a couple of bottles and share.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure, I think that sounds like a great idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You keep bees here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do as well, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mm... they're not immediately local. Would you like a tour of our hives?" (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to go so well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do have to ask, unfortunately, there is a tourist price for the tour."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Five silver."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wanted two bottles, that'll be 30 gold, and "you wanted how many cups? Or do you just want your bottles?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bunch of cups! Bunch of plates of gristle and meat and boar and fat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have anything that's more-- less meat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks up at you and goes, "Do not worry, honey, I get you, no problem. All right. I'll "prepare this." She does some calculations and goes, "All right, for all of that together with "your glasses for each of you, the meals prepared for each--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some tripe. Maybe some knuckles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some pastries, if you have them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, not much of a pastry opportunity out here on the Swavain."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (mimicking Bentha's accent) No cookies, no doughnuts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But she goes, "No doughnuts. However, for "everything involved, that would be 35 gold for all glasses of mead, all food provided."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could you get it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't look at me, I'm shit broke.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll throw a little in on this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I took 30 if you want to take the other five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And five silver for the tour for this blue young woman over here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems very fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The food is presented. It smells wonderful. The din is quite loud now as the various naval officers and naval soldiers of the Clovis Concord are surrounding the space and chatting, talking about bullshit. Some of it is in Common, some of it is not. While you guys are eating your food, anything else you want to do? The mead is quite good; it is very sweet. Even just finishing one glass, you're like, "Oh, this is dangerous," and probably going to give you a headache if you're not careful. What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many glasses did you have?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ren faire, ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, severe Ren faire flashbacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want any mead; I just want the honey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three o'clock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are in the process of eating your food, a recently-awoken and somewhat harsh-looking morning Yasha wanders over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You found us again. This is the sixth time. You just know where we are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, she was on the boat with us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She was on the boat, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, but she was just-- we're in a restaurant.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You guys just didn't wake me up for breakfast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were sleeping; you were snoring really loud, and it sounded like you were angry snoring.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, yeah, I guess, I did tell you I'm angry when I sleep. I don't like being woken up, I forgot, but it would've been nice to be woken up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is precisely why we didn't wake you up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But we did make you this plate of food.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (gobbling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pour her a very large glass of mead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go over and find Bentha and be like: Can we get one more plate of food, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comes by and slips it over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll hand that plate of food over to Nott: There you go. No, it's not for you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back out, back out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (food coming out of mouth noises)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are finishing your meal and Yasha's quietly staring into the plate and eating with a distant intensity, like she's prone to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're fitting to explore a little.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were going to go on a winery tour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's not-- we were going to look for incense and supplies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Insects, supplies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe some weapons or some potions that might help should we find ourselves--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We might also want to discuss what we're doing next. I mean, we just had this crazy escape from Pirate Island and now-- what are we doing, where are we going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want us to go to this temple?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I would like to, yeah. I saw it in my visions and I haven't had any other dreams since. I feel like this might be a good chance to put a dagger in it, you know? Finish it up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know where?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I have a feeling it's right in the middle of the archipelago that's just south of here. Maybe a day and a half, maybe two days most, depending on--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So more traveling on the water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a little bit and then we can go back to land. Nott. With the promise of land and no more requests to go to sea, if you'll do this for me I would be most obliged.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord, what was that naval officer--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, Nott.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. What was--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's being very nice today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I think he feels guilty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know he feels guilty. He asked you to accompany him off the boat, he offered to make a plate of food for you, he's being nice to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gasp) Is he hitting on you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think he's hitting on you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did that naval officer say to you about the war? What was I hearing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He was saying they've made their way south into the fucking town of... Nipple Bottom--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Felderwin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Felderwin, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's where some of us are from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we've been right near that area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're from Felderwin?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're from Felderwin?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Around there, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's far more south than they've been previously.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that freak anybody else out?

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about your... you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not far from my hometown either.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really? That maybe changes things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (rustling noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go to the map.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Point. Oh. That is pretty far west.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but he said that they were traveling under the mountains, and Kamordah is a mountain town, so...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Who's traveling under the mountains?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Xhorhasians.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They got under the mountains and attacked Felderwin.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what all these soldiers are here for; they're going to join the fight or something? What did they say, Fjord?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reinforcements?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They were going down the southern coast, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Most likely in an effort not to get flanked.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we should still go to the temple, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I don't feel quite as energetic, knowing that where you both are from is under siege.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm just being paranoid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm always paranoid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we went to the temple and then headed back? No dilly-dallying, we just go and make sure that everything's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It may only add a day or two at most. I would be most appreciative.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's finish this up, see what it has to say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to try to-- what are you going to do to Uk'otoa?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispering) Uk'otoa.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you self-echo?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I just thought I'd feel it out when I got there, all current and past events taken into account.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Feel out whether you would raise Uk'otoa from the dark and join its dark ways?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, god, no--! No. I do have two of these spheres, and I can't help but notice the extra shamalamadingdong that Avantika got by depositing one of them. I could keep the third and certainly keep that crazy fucking snake at bay. I would like to see this through. Otherwise, I feel like I'll always be wanting to get back here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus, we still haven't found out about Vandran.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, but he could be fucking anywhere. I want to do this because we're here. We can worry about that later; it's a wide, wide world.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we find the temple, and then what? I guess, go back to Nicodranas first, yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We might have to go through Port Damali, actually. Nicodranas is a little hot for us. But we could. We could let your mom know that you're okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can message her. I've been messaging her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like danger might be that way. It might be best to go the way we came.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So maybe some supplies? Something to buff us up a bit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some bees.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Some bees, yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think some bees would suit you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just really want to see them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can talk to them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really want to talk to them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've talked to many bees in my time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can teach me the language?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, you just: Hey, bees. How're you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 'Sup, bee?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, bees. Okay, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Bzz.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha, is there anything you need while we're in port? Anything you've been craving while we've been at sea?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. No, I just-- You guys were gone for a really long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't mean to be, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You were gone for six days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We didn't have any idea that that was going to happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we-- Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I looked for you guys everywhere in that room. I was just worried, is all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd be mad at us, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't need anything from here. I have everything that I need, so if we need to go, we can go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for looking everywhere in that room. That's really nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I just turned around, and then you all were gone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it was crazy in there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you have funerals for all of us? Must have taken a lot of time. Like one a day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, that actually would have covered everybody, the more you think about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was mine nice? Did anyone come? I guess not; you were on the ocean. Did you say anything?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did say some things that I probably should not share with you, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like, they're bad words or something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Something like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You cursed at my funeral?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't have a funeral for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't even get a funeral?! Everybody else did!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't know if you were actually gone!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone got a funeral but me!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! None of you did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god! You didn't give any of us funerals?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because I didn't know if you were alive or not! I was still holding onto maybe that you were and you just disappeared and you just didn't want to stay with me anymore! You didn't want me part of the group!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, we want you to be part of the group.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I don't mean it like that. I'm not saying, you know, "Woe, poor me," or something, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, was "alive or not" a joke? I always get confused when people use the word "not" in a sentence. Was that supposed to be a--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's confusing. Okay. Group rule: if any of us are missing for four or more days, we hold a funeral. Right? It's four days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, let's make it an even seven, like a week, right? Because that sphere's pretty fucking sweet. Not that I have any interest in messing with it any further.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hells no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If that dragon is dead, there's a lot of stuff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Though every time we did a little thing, a little of that loot comes out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Measured. Practical. That's my middle name. Fjord Practical--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your last name? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fjord Practical.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord Practical?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the next sedan coming out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any potion shops around here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Test drive a Ford Practical today.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What else have you found in there? Is there anything else? Did you already look at everything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb got some books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb is actually not over here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb's back at the boat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He decided to take some personal time to himself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To look at some books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everyone was a little thrown by what happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We almost died, Yasha. And then we really would have been dead and then we wouldn't have come back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I never would have known.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You fought something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a big blue dragon.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Eh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No bigs? No sweat?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, a Tuesday?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you going to show us the notches on your upper delt for all the ones that you--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fire!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She holds up a handful of shreds. Just fucked up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All those teenagers in hoodies are going like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was pretty gnarly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I'm glad you guys are safe, for whatever the fuck it's worth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's worth a lot, and probably we'll be a little more careful about poking things separately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was testing the texture. It wasn't even a push; I just touched it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it's the buddy system. No blame going around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before we go on the bee tour, if there's any time, do we see any magic shops? Weaponry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're doing the bee tour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to see some bees.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm looking for incense stores.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Magic shops, just so you guys are aware, are super rare. There's one in Zadash, and there's maybe one or two in Rexxentrum.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So there's definitely one here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's definitely not one here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three. Competing for the same turf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two regular healing potions you can find for sale for-- marked up because you're at sea-- 70 gold apiece.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Island prices.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where else are you going to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try and haggle, if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've got two clerics. You don't need it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put a lot of healing potions into my group.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm getting poor, you guys. I'm getting D&D poor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and find a blacksmith.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really? I've got lots of money.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't you buy us a couple potions?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'll buy both healing potions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There may not be much time for such things, but I was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depends on what you're looking for. There is a blacksmith by the name of Keisha Budan who does most of the metalwork for the ship repairs and other general goods that require metalwork around the island.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keisha?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach the space she has-- you can tell from the large smokestack pouring out of the top of the forge that she keeps-- but as you approach, you can see a young woman in her late 20s or so, massive arms, her thick black hair pulled back into a tuft, and she has a leather apron on. You can see now a lot of metal reinforcements used for holding beams together in shipbuilding, and she's laying them out one by one as she finishes hammering and then quenching and then hammering and quenching. As you walk up, she rubs her brow. "Can I help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possibly not. Seems like you have your hands full right now. I was hoping to, at the very least, get a professional opinion about something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can do my best. I don't get many like your height in here, anyway."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what they tell me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At the very least, I'm looking forward to sating my curiosity."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pull out a broken sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really hoping to be doing something with this at some point, and giving it as a gift to a friend who could use a pick-me-up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you have the other part of the weapon?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sadly, I don't. It may not exist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If given maybe a week with the right materials, I could maybe try to work on it, but "honestly, your best bet is probably to go into the coast. We don't do much in the way of masterwork "weapon craftsmanship here on Bisaft. My apologies."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's all right. They're definitely trying hard to get us to leave a little sooner than we'd necessarily like to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It has been very busy this past day or two."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has everything been all right, by the way? This seems like a lot of commotion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a lot of commotion, but they'll be gone soon. We get waves of people coming through."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, thank you so much for your time. I don't know what I could possibly do in return other than offer my gratitude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I have a hug?" (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes and takes it and cuddles you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You want the spine lift?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. You're quite fuzzy, and I was curious."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, thank you, it was a pleasure. I look forward to coming your way again one of these days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Any time. We're here on the island. Nowhere else to go."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is awfully nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are worse places to live, I'll tell you that. Have a good day. What's your name?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Caduceus. Keisha."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keisha. It's a pleasure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The pleasure was all mine."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will wander back to the bees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You walk away to the sound of (clanging) in the background as she goes back to work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did I find any incense?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depending on how much incense you want to get?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He did not give me an amount, so what's a normal amount of incense that you would need for a month of incense burning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For a person burning incense in their house?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Like a hippie person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say about 20 gold worth, which would cost you 25 here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll take 50 gold worth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you take 50 gold worth, but it'll cost you 60, we'll say. You mark off 60 gold, but you write down you have 50 gold worth of incense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. Cool. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The bee tour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello, bees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leads you through and is talking about how many years her family has been running the meadery and it's a wonderful place. There isn't much of an interest in mead out here in the island so she feels like she cornered the market a bit. She has friends that bring it to the other island towns and it makes a fair amount of money. She's very proud of it. As she's doing the talk, she leads you around. There are a small sect of wooden hive setups. You can hear already as you approach the slight hum of them. There's a young boy, maybe 12 or so, who is wearing a very thick smock with a hood, who is in the process of scooping out some of the honey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa! Do I need to wear a thingy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, well, stay here, preferably. Do not get close enough to let them sting you and if one's on "you, don't freak out and smack it, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, but I really want to go up to them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The tour is not intended to bring you that close."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello, bees? Hello, bees. Please come over here and let me say hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks very confused and goes, "Okay?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start walking very slowly. Hello, bees. I want some honey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you say that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "Well, if you want honey, I can get you honey."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but I want the honeycomb straight from the thingy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll for Nic Cage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the bees covered up his arm and he puts it over and hands it to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's gooey. It's very sweet and very waxy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I have a jar of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's walk back. I'll be happy to sell you a jar or two. How many would you like?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With the actual honeycomb in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want two jars.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two jars. That'll run you five gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." She claps her hands together happily and leads you back, telling you more about the waves of various traders and merchants that come through. Some individuals, some names, she throws out that she's met and flirted with and one that asked her to marry him when she was younger but she turned him down. You have no idea who any of these people are, but you can't help but be half-fascinated, because they're stories. You have two jars of honey plus honeycomb for five gold.

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: Hello, bees!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I come wandering in about the point where they're saying "Hello, bees," because this is really all I want.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can talk to them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Say something!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you want me to say to them? I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell them to come over here, but don't sting us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hold on, hold on. Let me do a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're approaching right as they're about to leave from the hives.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a little bit of the tea out of my pocket. I'm going to try and get a bloom going on my staff to try and get a flower to start going on. If I can get something to start going a little bit. It may not be temporary, using the Decompose. I don't know if you'll let me do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Druidcraft would be the creation of flowers, unfortunately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe they like mushrooms.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I can ask. Hey, guys. I don't have any flowers, but I have some mushrooms. I don't know if you'd be interested, but you're welcome to come over and take a look. It's probably going to rain pretty soon. It's looking a little iffy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not paying any attention to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're working really hard right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they look like it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've never seen bees before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've never seen bees before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you not have bees in Xhorhas?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We don't have flowers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Yeah, right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no greenery in Xhorhas?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's been collecting all those flowers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's sad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should fix that, one of these days.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't know any different.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they have mushrooms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the moorlands, they have--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: In the moorlands, there's some.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a marshland, where you're from.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a marshland, so there's occasionally--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not colorful mushrooms, just brown and gray and white? Maybe some black ones.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody else have anything else they want to grab?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we're good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got what I needed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got that plate of food for Caleb that you ate half of?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got the rest of it in my pockets. It's a little wet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it possible to put some basic supplies-- Is the ship already well-supplied for a trip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were given enough supplies for a week or so off of leaving Darktow, and you guys can create your own food and water. There's enough gunpowder for a dozen or so volleys of cannon fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd say a little bit of spice, so that the food that we're creating doesn't taste too bland.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: By all means.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would not be a bad idea, because the magically-created food is spongy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can drop a gold piece and be good for the next two weeks on flavoring the food for you and the crew.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we set off, or are we exploring this place more?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it still before sundown?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point in the day, it's starting to get close to dusk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might get some money back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 30 gold feels like a lot right now. Just saying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wonder what Caleb's up to right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, Caleb, during this time--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (flashback riff)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you've spent most of the day on the ship to your own devices, what are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pooping!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am a morning pooper, so that happened at the very beginning. Once I watched Yasha leave the boat, I would have snapped Frumpkin to, and set him purring, and worn him like a scarf. Go back to my chambers, and slowly and methodically take out the silver wire, and cast Alarm outside of my doorway. Then take another ten minutes to cast Leomund's Tiny Hut as a ritual in the room, so that the bubble goes up to the door. Then I will take out the jar of beads, and the thing of ink, and the sphere from Twiggy. I would rest that on the table. Then, as memory serves, there was one book with arcane equations open on the table, which I put away. Was there a second book on the table, at that point, as well? There was two we got in our rush, and Caduceus just gave him one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You have four books total, I think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stare at them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One thing you notice about the sphere: its arrangement is entirely different. Remember where all the places where you had shifted since you had gotten it from Twiggy? Since you've returned, it's like an entirely new sphere. It has completely refigured its surface. The bands have shifted. All the different places where you'd place your fingers and thumbs to try to move the different hemispheres are in completely different places. It seems that whatever you triggered to get you to the internal space and then returned from reset it in some way. The puzzle has started all over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After a minute of feeling Frumpkin purr away and staring at them, I say in my own language, in Zemnian, I say: Well, you piece of shit, you should probably get to work. I sit down, and I will Identify the two items. I will check out the books, and if any of them are locked, I will cast Knock on them to open them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's easy enough to do. The jar of beads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Every Flavor Beans.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Each one is a Fireball.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beads, or beans, or bees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The book.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bees, or bees, or bees.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beans, and beans, and beans.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And bees, and bees.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking ridiculous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, I hate that he doesn't say what it is out loud!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is his favorite thing to do, to hold a card and watch all of us wait for him to show it to us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Was ist das?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was is das? Das ist gut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that's the spell book.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is the ink normal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still need paper, but essentially, any parchment can be made useful as if was the most premium of spell craft parchment with that ink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking score.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Write it on your body. All over your body.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your body is a road map of pain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Memento.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is probably it, I would--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the books, too. The other books.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, right. Yes, correct. Yes, let's inspect the other three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one that speaks of public debate records within the forum of Zeidel regarding the moral implications of arcane experimentation on prisoners of Ghor Dranas and warnings of the war with the gods. It's a transcript of a debate forum. All you know about Zeidel-- make a history check, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Zeidel High, that's where Grease takes place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From your studies, Zeidel was one of a number of extremely erudite societies in the Age of Arcanum that had harnessed crystals to make their city hover aloft. There were a handful of these in the Age of Arcanum that could travel across Exandria, cities that were mobile. As far as anyone knows, all of them had been wiped out during the Calamity. Zeidel, as far as you've learned, is one of them. That's all you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispering) We're going to find the lost island of Teddy Ruxpin; I'm ready for this shit. Let's bring it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm. The last one discusses the theories behind the ice fields and the underreaches of Eiselcross and the beasts that live and endure it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eiselcross.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eiselcross. E-I-S-E-L-C-R-O-S-S. Eiselcross, you know, is a rather large body of land to the north of the main Wildemount continent. It's considered part of Wildemount overall, but it's just a frozen arctic cap.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not separated in any way, just frozen over, to the north, or is it separate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's separate. The Frozen Depths-- there's a large channel of water that separates the main body of Wildemount and Eiselcross, but aside from two very small ice fishing villages that are expansions of the Dwendalian Empire, it is mostly uninhabited. Nobody really goes there. There's a bunch of creatures that have spent a millennia or more living in that place that are extremely dangerous, and it's just snow and ice, so nobody goes there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, there's nothing else that I would do. I would say that all the time they were gone, he sits rolling the ball on the table and speed reading these books. That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool enough. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) The Frozen Depths.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eiselcross is far north of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Oh, farther north.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Even Frozen-er Depths.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Off the map, or on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Off the map.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going off the map, man! Probably need a special boat for that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought it was time for some Mercer Mystery. Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys manage to make your way back. You manage to recover your 30 gold from the dockmaster, Podderan. You get back to your ship and you, Caleb, hear the rest of your party return as the rest of the crew begins to prepare for setting sail off the dock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go over to Caduceus and I pull him aside really quick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Cad, I have a thought.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As you may have heard, I have now become first mate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't know that; people don't tell me those sorts of things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, really? No one told you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, they might, I just might forget.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You may have already told me, I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think that we're abusing them, but maybe neglecting them? Anyway, I got this extra bottle of mead for them, and I thought maybe, with some of the stuff we got, maybe we could do a nice dinner for them or something to just show our appreciation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a very good idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really don't want to get stabbed in the middle of the night is what I'm thinking, so it's a little bit still selfish. But really don't want to die by one of these fuckers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Show our appreciation to these fuckers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You made Caduceus laugh, oh no. It's not even me laughing. Well, I can think of worse plans than a nice bottle of wine with a card that says, "Please don't stab me in the middle of the night."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, a card! I didn't think-- you think they'd appreciate that? I could write that down, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, I actually think that maybe not giving them the idea in the first place might be a better-- well, yeah, I think the big deal will be when we finally do find a little money, making sure it spreads around a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But, bringing back some of the mead and dispersing it amongst the crew is definitely a sign that we're probably going to do that when we do. That is very astute of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks. I feel like a first mate should be astute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a confession. I don't know what astute means; I heard one of the crew use it, so I'm hoping it means a good thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does; you used it pretty correctly, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was mirroring something somebody else said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nailed it, man, yeah. Good work. Okay, I'm going to go now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I start prepping the boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. With that, as everyone gets prepared, Orly comes out from underneath the deck and turns to you and goes, "Captain, where about are we taking off towards?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Navigator, set course for the Gravid Archipelago, "ar-chi-pelago", "ar-ka-pelagos".

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's 'ar-chi-pelago'."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Ar-chi-pelago."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now the sky itself has been pretty gray and cloudy, and you've been smelling the coming of weather. No more than 20 minutes after leaving, the rain begins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is fucking unexpected; the skies were pretty clear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caduceus knew that it was going to rain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Huh. That is one smart cow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was waiting for your response.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's Yasha? Is she staring off into space, or just doing stuff? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For most of this travel, you've kept an aspect of your consciousness looking out for errant weather, and there've been a few moments where some rains have come through-- that brief interaction with the Diver's Grave in which a storm was conjured, but it didn't have the same feel that you'd been hoping, whatever this draw was that drew you southward and to run into these friends again at the coast. As you begin to push further and further towards the direction of the storm, there's an excitement in your belly that you can't describe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're looking for a sign?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess I'm always looking for a sign, now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah? How did you know it was going to rain? I mean, other than the obvious, gray skies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, the skies were turning; the wind was coming in; and I honestly have to mention my knee hurts a little bit on the left side, usually about an hour beforehand. It was a thing my sister did. It was 25 seasons ago, give or take. She's a piece of work. She's great. A piece of work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It just hurts when it gets cold type of a thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, usually half a day before it rains.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a pretty great indication.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rain begins to hit the deck itself, the endless patter of heavy droplets smattering against the dark wood, the winds begin to pick up a little bit, and some of the crew begins to look off.
