You see Marius glance off and go, "Captain, should we put up the storm sails? The wind's "picking up a bit."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course. Storm sails, it is. On the double!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes them a little bit--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why aren't they up already?! [inaudible]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They start diminishing the presence of the regular sails and getting smaller, more durable sails pulled up in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pay attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goes, "Captain, I think we're heading into a "proper storm."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn, could you be more ominous, Orly? Were you trying? I think he was trying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (more ominous) "Captain, we're heading into a proper storm."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was good. I think that was pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Smartass."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Orly, do you see any way around this storm, or just through it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can if we take a few more days to--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unacceptable. Push through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye, aye, Captain. All right, everyone! All hands on deck!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's flashes of light over there. I don't know what's happening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As everyone gathers to begin to ford out into the evening--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Safe, practical, measured.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I was almost like: Captain?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an amazing list of things that you are not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your nerves are slightly set on edge as you can see the distant flashes of lightning arcing from storm to ocean, the heavy sheets of wind obscuring most of these bolts. With that, the rain gets heavier and heavier. I need you, as the captain, to roll a survival check for me, if you don't mind. I'll give you advantage on this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: O Captain! My Captain!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, before we go into the storm, you want to look in the old fate-changing thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had advantage on it already. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that adds onto advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it acts as a luck point. It actually technically is a third die, but you've already rolled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good. Keeping it steady in going in, the ship's handling it fine. The winds are heavy, but the repairs you made, thankfully, have brought the Balleater up to a very functional ship. The crew is experienced, and now that they seem to be a little more comfortable under your leadership, and with the help of the rest of the party - you guys have taken some time at sea to learn a number of skills that are helpful - your first bit of evening travel into the storm seems to be going well. It goes on for a few hours. The storm doesn't seem to be getting worse, necessarily, but the waves are rocking quite a bit. Eventually, into the early hours of the morning, sleep is going to have to come to some of you, at the very least.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I definitely could use some sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're going to sleep. Who's staying up for how long to keep watch? Or you can leave it to the crew; it's up to you. They're experienced, but you're the captain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'll stay up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're staying up? Where are you staying?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At the helm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orly's staying with you. Anybody else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you need me to stay up, Captain?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, get some rest. I might need it in a bit, when this dies down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stand at the back of the boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody else sleeping?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to stay up, of course. Just watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before I go to bed, I would like to talk to Jester, unless Jester is having some alone time and it doesn't seem like it's the right time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I just want to be able to Control Water if something happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you're here keeping watch? That's a good call, actually. Going to stay up much longer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Depends on the storm, I guess.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Motion sick?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wood is creaking with each shift of the boat as the waves climb higher and higher, occasionally slamming into a valley between.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Feels like a carnival ride.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a little spooky, right? It's fun, though. Listen, I wanted to talk to you for a moment. I'm not really good at this sort of thing, but about what you said last night, about being a good liar. You're right. You really are a good liar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I think it takes one to know one. I think being a liar means when I know you're not, does that make sense?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And when you are. Look, we all get sad. I want you to know that. I haven't told you really any of this, but I also had a lonely childhood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You did?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I didn't have a lot of friends. My father was very protective because of certain things that he believed, so I wasn't allowed to have a lot of friends. Really any friends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could have used the Traveler in your life, too, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe. Maybe I would have turned out a little bit more like you. I admire that in you. In my loneliness, I got angry and turned to bad things, but in your loneliness, you turned to creativity. I think that's beautiful. I really do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll tell you a secret.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes I'm angry, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really? I don't think I've ever seen you angry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a sight to behold!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd like to see it someday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Someday I'm sure you will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be proud of that, too. Anyway, I know you like to look for friends. I don't know if I'm best friend material. That might be a lot of commitment, especially with my commitment of being first mate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really big, yeah. You already have a lot on your plate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It really is, but you don't have to look far for a friend. Anyway, I'll leave you to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give her a hug from behind as she's walking away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hug her back from behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Love you, Jes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't stay up too late.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you are enduring the chaos of the rains above, keeping focused and keeping it steady, it's exhausting, both the attention required for you specifically and the hour being late. Thankfully, you slept in, so you can go on for quite some time. Yasha, where on the ship are you standing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Anywhere I can be helping Fjord. If they need help with the lines--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The lines seem to be okay. Fjord's at the helm with Orly, so they're both towards the back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I want to stay anywhere on the boat where the storm is most visible, so I guess--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably closer to the bow or the foremast.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's where I'll be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. In keeping this going, do you head back up to help Fjord, or are you heading to rest as well?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I head to rest. He gave me permission to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hypnotic, the sound of rain, and the movement of the waves, and the flashes of light, and the rolling of thunder. You grab the edge of the rail of the bow, looking out straight into the storm that you're passing into. It's a blur of light and movement and darkness. The horizon beyond your vision is obscured; it feels like you're riding this into a tumultuous sky. You begin to fall into a trance, your eyes closing for but a second. We're going to take a break.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be right back in a few minutes. In the meantime, we do have our fantastic Wyrmwood giveaway from our friends at Wyrmwood! This is an awesome holly inlaid dice vault with burmese sal burl wood with a red interior. This is a gorgeous fucking piece. It feels nice. I want to keep it, but no, this has to go to one of you lucky winners. You have to move over to the Critical Role Twitch chat at twitch.tv/criticalrole to enter during the break. You can jump on back to Geek & Sundry after, but the keyword tonight is holiday. Put holiday once in the chat; more than once and you'll be disqualified.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Celebrate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, there wasn't a single dick joke in that name. Congratulations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the rest of you are currently either focused on helping on the ship itself or are down below deck, resting, sleeping, or concentrating on whatever is needed. Taliesin? Oh, you're just saying you're down there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was doing things with flourish, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gotcha. It's important.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the nicest way anyone has ever put that; thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly, two vibrant wings of lightning open from its back like an angel. It walks towards you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to claw across the front of your body.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 14? Don't you have a shield or something? Jesus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She can rage; she doesn't need a shield.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rage doesn't raise it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it claws across the front of your body, its hand seems to almost pass through the resistance of the armor for but a minute before you feel this shock to your system as it arcs through; you feel the lightning pulse through your body. You suffer eight points of bludgeoning damage plus five points of lightning damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would we have seen the lightning hit the ship?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were below deck, and there--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you're upstairs. You guys watched a bolt of light strike down towards the ship. All you see is this faint, dull glow, like a mote of energy that's rolling around. Make a history check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've heard tales of something called ball lightning, bits of storm matter that just scatters across. It's usually innocuous and people either watch it fizzle out or get it thrown overboard. It usually happens in the cusp of a storm, and you watch it dance along the vicinity of Yasha. But that's not what you see. I need you to roll initiative.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All alone?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I get advantage now. Oh, fuck. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, it's going first.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My low fucking initiative!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reel from it, reaching back for your blade, the creature seems to be intent on you, its form seeming to shift and bend with the wind and the rain. It's going to reach out towards you for two more strikes. That is going to be a 13 to hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 14 armor class.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 16 to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be five points of bludgeoning and two points of lightning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Which brings me to seven total? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Now that I know this is not who I thought it was, I am going to rage. I would like to rage, and in that rage, I'm going to unfurl my wings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, that's only the second time, I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your skeletal wings flare out from under your back, your hair blown up from the wind and the impact of the wings flying out from underneath the shawl. It needs to make a wisdom saving throw, I believe?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Charisma saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a six. It has no bonus. It is afraid of you for how long?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, this is-- one minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Does it get to save at the end of its turn, or is it just afraid of you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hold on. (mumbling) "Be frightened of me until the end of the next turn."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, got you. Oh, and then it lasts for a minute if you do the extra damage. Once during each of your turns you deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you do damage to it. It equals your level, so you do an extra seven points of necrotic damage once per turn to it. Keep that in mind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the end of the round. You guys look over and watch Yasha at the end, this mote of lightning dancing around her, rolling across, but slightly hovering above the surface of the boat's deck. Suddenly, she unleashes her fallen form, the wings rising up. Other members of the crew that are holding down the ropes see this and take a step back, not entirely familiar with this appearance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Steady!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Only within ten feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a nine and a 21 to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, that one hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's going to be eight points of bludgeoning damage reduced to four because you're raging, plus four points of lightning damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Oh god, I've lost count.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, still hits because it's frightened of you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 71 minus seven...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you're-- because the other one missed, so I think you're at--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to attempt-- all right. It's going to attempt to move away from you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I try and grab it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can attempt to. I'll let you grapple as a reaction, sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll grapple as a reaction. Oh, fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an athletics check for you; because you're raging, it's at advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With advantage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's staying. You reach out and your hand passes partly through it and it goes numb, the field of sparkling energy lightly electrifying the skin around your hand. But you manage to get hold of something-- it's not solid matter, but something. As it tries to move away, you keep it there, barred in place. That ends its turn; it's your go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, I'm going to take out my sword and I'm going to attack it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it, you've got two attacks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay that's-- okay. Oh wow, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you doing this reckless or not?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit! Sorry. No, I'll take the first roll. Sorry. I'm forgetting everything. No, I'm not doing reckless. It was 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, okay, so I'll take out my sword and I'll attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Describe to me your attack. As you're holding it with one hand and pulling the blade out...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I say: You're not going anywhere. I'll attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is she doing? What is Yasha doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grasps it, grabs her blade, and strikes through with both hands arcing downward. Because you do have two hands, you'd lose the grapple because it is a two-handed weapon.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, that's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you also have sentinel, so if it tries to get away, you can hit it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus your rage damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was plus the seven?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus the seven? No. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus the seven once per round. 30 points of damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah! First attack, second attack!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jeez Louise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you get two attacks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have two attacks every turn. I know it's been a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 2d6 on the second one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 2d6 on the second one, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know you forgot your sheet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I'm sorry. Okay, 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 does not hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was a two plus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I'm afraid that does not. This first swing strikes through. You watch the spark flash with energy for a second. The second swing goes wide. It moves around, zigzagging as it curls around her. You want to do anything, or just watching?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I want to run forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you rush over in the direction of where she is and this entity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha! Do you need help?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But if you want to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make a dexterity saving throw. You do have advantage on this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I have advantage on, okay. That's 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 does not make it.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's a lot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh god, that's a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 23 points of lightning damage, and as the bolt hits you, your whole upper torso goes numb. Your fingers aren't responding, and you drop your sword to the ground. The creature bends down and picks it up, and holds it up, looking right at you. Doesn't move. Your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It has to move. Isn't it frightened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not anymore. And frightened doesn't force you to move; you just can't get closer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That looked like it hurt. Do you want to be healed?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe? A little lower than I thought I would be. Can I try to grapple again and try to get my sword back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can use an attack to try and disarm it, if you'd like.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'd like to try and disarm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make another athletics check. You have advantage on it, because you're raging.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It had a plus three and rolled a 13, so 16.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it didn't succeed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was like, "How?!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it pulls back, attempting to use Magician's Judge against you, you reach forward and grab it and, for a moment, you're both struggling back and forth. You manage to rip it from its hand, its fingers actually evaporating as you rip it from its form, and then reform where they were previously. The energy's still arcing around it, and it moves around to almost try and move to your flank, but you shift around to face it. You have your other attack, if you'd like.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. Okay. Oh no. (sighs) Forgot to reckless. Can you call out reckless? I'm forgetting everything!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beforehand, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You have to call it out beforehand, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You call it at the beginning of your turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 does not hit. Goes wide. Unfortunately your body's still numb from the impact of the lightning bolt. You reel from it angrily. That finishes your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I heal her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to roll to get involved? Roll initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just want to heal her. Oh, I rolled really low. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six? Yasha, your initiative was?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Jester, you can go. I'll let you in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to run up and go: Keep going! You're doing great! I'm going to touch her arm and cast level three Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 20 points of healing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh shit, okay. I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Jester touches you and the healing goes through, the entity before you, its eyes flare with intense energy, glaring right at Jester, and it swells to twice its size with her presence arriving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, get the hell out of there!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't know! I was trying to help! Did I see that happen, or did it just look like a ball to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch this thing all of a sudden get brighter and more intense. You don't know what that means. Top of the round, its turn. It's going to take two more strikes at you. Let me see if it gets its lightning back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lightning back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. All right. It's going to make two more strikes at you, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh. That's going to be a 20 and a 21.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, both hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First one comes at you with ten points of bludgeoning damage, reduced to five, and five points of lightning damage, so ten total. The other strike, 11 points of bludgeoning damage reduced to five, and then three points of lightning damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks. No, I would have been under. Okay, my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be growing in size.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck. Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your turn, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How are you attacking with it? What are you doing to attack? It's whipping around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It hit you anyway, you might as well do it, because you'll get reckless back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to see if there's a vital that I can get to anywhere. How much bigger than me is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now he's considered a large creature, so he's about five feet taller than you. You see only maybe a three-foot sphere, glowing in its face, but it's larger than the one foot it once was.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to try to go for the big artery in the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you swing, coming down towards where the leg is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reckless?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did reckless, yeah. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Three? Oh, not as good. (counting) Plus seven, still? Or that was a one-time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, every turn you do it once, plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Carves through the center of its leg area, you watch as energy dissipates. The leg goes (poof) and vanishes. Now it's hovering lightly with the other leg below it. You see energy sparking around where the leg's reforming.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (groans) Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing with your second attack?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Since I have reckless, I can still continue to do it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reckless for all your attacks this round, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry, guys. Okay, 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits. Roll damage a second time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points of damage. You strike it again with the blade. It seems to shrug it off. It seems to be hardier than it was when you started this fight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you do on your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have any bonus actions?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you been adding your seven points of damage, necrotic?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I only get it once, I don't get the necrotic damage also on the second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Both strikes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Both strikes? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What, the necrotic damage?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For divine fury.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Divine fury you get once per turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but the sword has necrotic, right? Or your shroud?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The necrotic damage from your shroud also happens once per turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sorry. Yeah, just once.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Sounds good. Oh, fuck, I don't know what to do! I feel like I have to fight this thing on my own.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a bonus action, you haven't done anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Features and traits.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Check your features and traits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's all pretty awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, should I do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I guess I'm going to back away from it, since I made it worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. How far do you back away?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you back away ten feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry! Didn't mean to join anything and didn't know what's going on here. Looks pretty crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Jester backs away, top of the round, it's now the entity's turn. First let's see if it gets its-- it gets its lightning back. It's going to first attempt to move away from you. It's going to hover away and actually begin to rise up in the air. You do get an attack of opportunity towards it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sentinel!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is not reckless, though, because it's only on your turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it pulls its arm down, the bolt strikes down and slams into you once more. Make another dexterity saving throw with advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. 20 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That succeeds. Okay, and that's a good thing. You take 13 points of lightning damage and you do not drop your weapon. You shrug off the numbness from the impact, but it is 15 feet above you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is out of your melee range. It's up near the sail on the mast. It's your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I call out to the Stormlord. What do you want me to do?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you wait for a response?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No response. Just the sound of thunder and lightning rolling.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I move closer to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you move closer to it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it directly above me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's above and back, up by the mast and the sail. About 15 feet above you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sighs) This is so stressful when it's about you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you fly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not with the wings, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I wish. Yeah, I'm going to try to climb up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go ahead, and as it's up in the air, you rush over to the mast. Climbing your way up, you get to the edge and there is, where the sail is in the side, you're holding onto it off the point, you manage to get within melee range of it. You used your action to call out to the Stormlord and waiting for the response, but you're now adjacent to it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. So I'll just keep my sword at the ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Jester? You move further away, get closer, re-enter, what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, what do you want me to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. Just stay safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah! I back up ten more feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, ten more feet. Next round. You watch its physical size reduce. It shrinks back down to its original form, matching yours one-to-one. As it floats there, its electrical wings not flapping but arced, held aloft at each of its sides. On its turn it does not get its lightning back. It's going to attempt to strike at you twice. As it rushes you towards the mast, trying to knock you off, the first one's going to be a shove attack to try and knock you off the mast. That's a natural one. No. It goes to shove towards you and you just pull in, and it zips past. At that point it comes back around to try and claw at you with its other hand. That's going to be a 20 to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (background music, thunder)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Wait, still? Just one? Well, the first one was good. 21 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Roll damage. And because of your sentinel feat, you prevent it from moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, you drop their speed to zero!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sentinel, bitches!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points of damage. As you arc past with your blade and strike at it, attempting to move away, its midsection separates, and the lower legs fizzle out and no longer exist. Suddenly, its lower part of its torso flickers and then grows two new legs made of pure electrical energy. As the wind's blowing by, your hair being thrown past your shoulders, the rain beating down on your face as you're holding onto the side of the mast, leaning your arm in and then striking with your two-handed sword best you can, it can't seem to find its way beyond your reach. Now it's your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to try to take my blade and put it through its torso.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to say, because of the rain-- didn't do it last round, but as you're now up in this area holding on while also striking it, you have disadvantage on the attacks because it is a two-handed weapon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But if you make it reckless, it's a straight roll.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah, reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. That's...18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (counting) 19-- oh, I'm sorry. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 points of damage to it. As it arcs past, one of the wings gets shaved off and falls and sputters and turns to particle sparks before vanishing into the storm. The wing begins to flicker to regrow itself. You have your second attack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's right. Okay. Still reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, reckless is preventing the disadvantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit, okay. That doesn't hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A three plus-- nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. This one, unfortunately, goes wide with the second strike as your arm's looped through the mast, trying to hold on. This time, the other wing manages to flicker in and it just ducks out of the way. Jester, staying out or coming in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Staying out of it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Back to the top of the round. The creature now-- you see the storm growing heavier and heavier around, the rain now is coming in heavy sheets across the deck. The crew's yelling off; you hear the shouting of the crewmen trying to keep the sails from tearing. You hear Fjord shouting orders to them from behind, but the words aren't reaching you. It's just noise lost in the wind and the sound of the storm around you. It's going to attempt-- we'll see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can do it, Yasha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does get its lightning strike back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (whispering) Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're up there holding the mast, knowing it's coming, as the creature puts its hands up, the bolt strikes down once more, slamming to you and the mast. I need you to make another dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we just got that repaired.

lines.name: TALIESIN, TRAVIS
lines.text: Advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (dice rolling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wasn't a great roll, so you're lucky on that. That's 13 points of lightning damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) I'm still standing.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you drop your sword.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which falls onto the ground. That's its turn. What are you doing, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god! Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Merry Christmas.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far away is it from you on that mast?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. How far-- yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's five feet from you. It hasn't pulled away. You've prevented it from leaving, but it did manage to knock the weapon out of your hands.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there anything in the torso?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The full thing is made of energy from different intensity levels that almost give variations to colors of blue and white.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I want to try to grab it again. Grab it from the inside and try to pull it off of the mast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check. You do not have disadvantage on this. You have advantage because of your--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're raging still.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, that's right. Both the same. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a second attack. Are you doing another grapple or are you--?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to do another grapple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. With advantage, because you're raging.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it does not succeed on that. As it ducks past the one, you reach out, getting to the limits of your arm reach from the edge of the mast. As you do, your hand plunges into its chest.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I pull it off of the mast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glaring past, you can hear the waves crashing around you. The ship itself is rocking with heavy momentum, but you're focused on the moment. On its turn, it's going to attempt to attack you. That is a natural one. You are lucky, but the second one is a 13 again. Wait, wait. Yeah, 13. Plus six. Shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One below your AC!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Man, okay. Oh, let's see. It does not get its lightning back. That would have been good to roll beforehand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, my turn? I want to keep holding, and I want to squeeze even harder whatever it is that I'm holding onto, and try to yank down and take us off the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The mast.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The mast. Do I roll again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Strength has advantage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck, I'm sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the raging. It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to pull, and it's giving. As you're yanking, its wings are flickering and sputtering. Its arms are reaching up to grab yours, and its eyes that have been intensely burrowed toward you begin to go wide.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to keep trying to pull whatever that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another strength check with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crackling, pop) As you pull it from the chest, the body flickers out, and you're falling, the momentum pulling you off of the mast. You plummet 15 feet, slamming into the deck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As I see her falling, I run forward to try to cast Cure Wounds right as she--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take five points of bludgeoning damage from the impact, reduced to two because of the rage. You crack down onto the hard wood of the deck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am at one hit point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No fucking way!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes fucking way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's two episodes in a row.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just laying there, and I'm holding--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look down at her. Are you okay?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. Am I still holding it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your fingers are buzzing. You look, and there's nothing there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you see that thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw a ball of light. I saw you fall off the mast.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You didn't see any creature or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a big ball of lightning stuff. Your sword fell down. Here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was fighting something. It was a creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did it look like? Cure Wounds.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was winged, and it had red eyes. It looked like it was a ball of lightning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think it meant?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. I was standing in front of the ship, and I had a vision of home. Then I woke up, and then the lightning struck. When it came down, it was the creature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It only wanted to fight you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess, if you didn't even see it. I grabbed something out of it. I guess it was its heart. Now it's gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, this is really important.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Well, maybe I need to think on this a little bit more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should talk to Caduceus.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. He has really good insight. Plus, he makes good tea. It will make you feel better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, what's going on down there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha fought a ball of lightning, but everything's okay! She's good. We're going to get some tea, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm okay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The mast looks like it maybe got burned a little again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe see to the repairs first before you get your fucking tea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't you stop being a dick?! I crawl up and cast Mending on the sail. By the way, you're healed 14 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because the lightning mostly impacted Yasha, the damage was minimal to the mast, thankfully. If she had succeeded on her save... Oh wait, no. You succeeded the last save.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She did succeed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mast is a little damaged, but with immediate Mending, I'll say you can undo it a little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus, I'm one of the carpenters. I've got extra skills.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to go talk to Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you continue to help keep this ship going through the middle of this storm, you make your way below deck and find Caduceus in his chamber.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (snoring)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (grunting awake)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sniffing) Did you get hit by lightning?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. Hold on. Oh man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry. Burning hair is not a good smell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's do it at third. Let's give you another 3d8 plus five to get that going. What happened?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I was-- oh, that would've been nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I was at the bow of the boat, and I was trying to connect with the Stormlord. I don't know. I ended up getting a vision.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got a sign?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got hit. You're pretty fried.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm pretty fried. I fought something, though. It was lightning that came down and then turned into a creature.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know how to make this sound normal. Did it know you? Did it feel like it was there for you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where's your sword?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's amazing. Well, now that you seem to have the Stormlord's attention, now what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess he's found me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's what I was going to ask you. I'm going to go back upstairs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go make tea. (sighs) And I go make tea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go back upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since it was your vision, if you wish to look over the words that were told to you, keep that for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) Clues.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Clues and clues!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Zoinks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Clues and clues and beans and beans.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look at the first letter of every word, and then take those and rearrange them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get some lemon juice and a candle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go back upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the dock-- To the deck?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I just want to sit outside still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way back up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it peaceful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still raining, but the storm's ferocity seems to have slowly diminished. It's still a storm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Less steady!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you seem to have come through the bulk of its intensity and danger, and, from your experience, knowing you're probably starting to come out the other end. It'll be a few more hours of fording this, but you're getting pretty exhausted.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I may send Orly or someone else below decks to go wake up Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Orly stays, but sends Marius to go ahead and wake Beau, comes back up, and she's in his wake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Sup?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (mumbling) Nothing, just going (gibberish).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (yawns) I'm so tired. Thank you, Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The ship's name makes sense, now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Balleater. Oh, yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The eater of balls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And also, our captain also eats balls!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody. Now I feel better about the whole-- It's a good name. It works out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing to the tune of "Moon River") Ball eater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You feeling any better, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess so. I'm just trying to make sense of all this still. I feel like-- I had some visions of home that made me very happy and sad at the same time, but it must all mean something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What made you leave in the first place? (background music)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Um.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It had to be scary, right, if that's all you'd ever known.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I had to leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did something that... I did something that wasn't the right thing to do, according to my tribe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can say what it is; (whispering) I won't tell anyone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: In my tribe, we have a matriarch of the tribe, the Champion, and her name is the Skyspear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, that's a cool name.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And when you become a part of the tribe, you take a blood oath and you get a name, and I was given the name Orphan Maker. When you become a part of the tribe, as time goes on, you are given a mate. But I fell in love with someone else that was not chosen for me, and we got married privately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) You got married, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did. But they found out and the punishment for that is death, and they killed her and I ran away, so I... I am a coward, I guess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha, you're not a coward. You're one of the bravest people I've ever met.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you, Jester. In our tribe, when you get married, it's for life. Even if she's gone, she'll always be mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was her name?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Her name was Zuala.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really beautiful.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. I left and I'm sure they were coming after me and I got into the wastes of Xhorhas, and something happened. There's time that I cannot account for. I was out there for months by myself, and it seems like I woke up months later and I looked different and I felt different. I woke up at an altar of the Stormlord, and he saved me. For what, yet, I don't know, but hopefully I can be a better champion for him and fulfill whatever purpose he has for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he heal your heart, or are you still sad?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (background music)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And then Molly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then Molly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like I'm either very unlucky or cursed, and I don't believe in luck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Curses and luck, they go together. If you don't believe in luck, you can't believe in being cursed either.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Molly's still with us, the same way that your beautiful wife is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I think so. I think so. This is very good tea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Been saving it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's in here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) You didn't put some of that stuff in, did you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that-- no. Although, I did think about it. No, this is from home. This is the Cadence family, if I recall? It's very minty.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: (laughing) Very minty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) The Cadence family?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like it's people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, technically, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm fine with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (background music)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, maybe this is best kept to us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I won't tell anyone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, I'm fine with saying it, but it's a long story, and...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you for trusting us with that, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes it helps to say things out loud.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think so. I feel like I'm trying to learn that from you, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, you say what's on your mind--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to start doing that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To surviving.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To surviving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To minty families!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To minty families.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The mintiest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the storm subsides slowly over the next few hours, and one by one, you all eventually find yourself feeling comfortable to return to your quarters for an evening's rest, the day's travel comes to a complete circle. The morning comes with clear skies as the distant gray fades in the north. Another half day's travel leads you to see a few bodies of land on the horizon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, nice job.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sharply inhales) Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was awake the whole night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which direction are we pointed?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The one we're heading in, Fjord, which is the only way we could be heading.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Orly--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Orly, which way are we heading?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I reckon towards them islands." He points over to the bodies of land on the horizon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Towards the islands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice job.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With little safe land to navigate or exploit for resources, there is very few reason for ships to stop here. As you guys begin to make your way, you can see the two nearest to you and the third there. What would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plot a course that would put us right in the middle of all three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay." He goes ahead and continues the path of the Balleater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll work on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing quite like high fantasy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Balleater?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was the Squalleater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we just painted it--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The boat is called the Balleater?

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Balleater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eater of balls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To be fair, he's eaten some balls--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now you have as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've eaten some balls?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You just bested a ball.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You busted a ball.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's true, that's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've all had a couple of balls in our mouth before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We spent six days in that Happy Fun Ball.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot of balls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true! I'm telling you, it's a ball-themed year.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is practically a ball pit, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matthew Mercer's ball campaign.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is going to go real poorly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not our fault!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nice lightning strike as you said that, by the way. It was like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Real poorly. (cracking)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This can be turned off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was enjoying it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fun device.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is awesome, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Jeremy Crawford, for showing me that at the Stream of Many Eyes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is the plan, Captain?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to head for the middle of all that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have to go to the bottom of the ocean again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe. We're going to keep our eyes on the islands as we proceed, but I do recall it being under the depths.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are searching for this based on a vision?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Also, it was in Avantika's journal, wasn't it? You remember, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did it have an exact location or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it just said somewhere between them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In my dream, I saw from the top down, and I hit the water right in the middle of them and kept going deeper and deeper.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right in the middle of these three islands?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord, there are presumably three spheres, yeah? Right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have one. You have two, and then Avantika. I'm checking if you think that this could unleash Uk'otoa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope. Nope, nope. She put hers in the first temple. I have two. This might be numero dos, and then I'll keep the third.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vandran has that one, but he's also already put it in the temple, and this third one could unleash him!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait. Four spheres, three temples?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or ten spheres.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have no idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it only takes three?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not sure that elder gods work in baker's dozens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would be very embarrassing for the people who designed that temple we visited.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right, and as Caleb can attest to, that image that we saw in the temple was three spheres. Three chosen people underneath the entity. I don't think they would have an influx of spheres to deal with.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if someone else was searching for these powerful spheres and maybe was lying in wait at this temple, knowing that someone would maybe come bring one to it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, you are a fantastic rogue. You wouldn't let such an ambush befall us, would you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would if it were underwater because I would not be there to prevent it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not going to come with us again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck no! Look what happened last time. There was a crazy ghost lady!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and we defeated her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, she got away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but we still defeated her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We almost died.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We got the orb! We also stole some shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I got at least five gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those that want to come can. I will understand if you want to sit this one out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've come a long way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome to stay, although there might be a conversation about how much of the cut of whatever we find you get to keep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Agreed, and I couldn't guarantee your safety up here while we're below the murky depths.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to force you to come, of course not. You can stay up here if you want, and I'm not going to talk about dangers, and murky depths, and stuff like that. I will say that you saved my life, and I don't feel as comfortable going into a battle without you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fjord, you have a thing or two to learn from Jester about talking to people and engaging them on a personal level. She has what I would call the expert touch. She gets people. She sees into their hearts and souls. You are just a bastard man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hear there is an ancient button factory at the bottom of the waters--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, Button Wonka's factory? With the boompa-loompas?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've heard of it as well!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have! No one's seen anyone come in or out of that factory, and yet it makes buttons every day! How do they do it?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The story's been lost to the ages, since the great Calamity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's find it; then we'll decide later.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough. Just in case, can we keep an eye on the islands as we're moving in for any sign of structures, civilization?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, whoever is helming that will be able to make either two separate perception checks or aid one to make--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll send the perceptive fuckers up to the crow's nest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep, take a look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you aiding Caduceus, or are you both rolling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's you? Am I doing this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're aiding Cad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll aid you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perception rolls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception, yeah. With advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perception with advantage. That's awful! That's terrible. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You keep an eye out there and spend the next hour or so, as you guys are coming into position, scanning the shores of each of the islands. There's no sign of civilization. They're mostly dangerous, jagged, rocky shores with pebbled beaches, and bits and pieces of hints of mangrove clusters at certain points of the shore, and elements of the occasional bit of jungle you can see in pockets or valleys on each island. For the most part, you don't see any sign of civilization.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing so far. Mr. Caleb, I know this is not your favorite thing to do, but we may require the use of your friend for a little while.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you going to do with the cat?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I was hoping that maybe the cat would get uncomfortable in either a bird or an octopus form and do a little reconnaissance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is no bird or octopus; he is a cat. I am out of supplies for-- he's a cat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got incense, by the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything just changed. How much did you get?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got 50 gold worth, which was a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I have it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You may have all of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. Where do we want to dump him in the ocean again for a look around?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're looking for signs of civilization on land or in the sea at the moment. What are you--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we haven't seen anything on land, I'd like to get in the middle and then send him below.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we in the middle yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say about now you guys could have reached what would be considered as close to the center as Orly can possibly maneuver the boat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No carvings in caves, holes in the stone walls?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can do two things. We can send Frumpkin into the air and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there are caves all over the volcanic, rocky cliffs and peaks that come out each island. There are caverns and shelves. It was a violently-made series of islands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you go underwater in your vision?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In my mind pictures? Yeah, I did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your mind pictures.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll sit down on the deck and start drawing in chalk on the wood and putting my cat in the middle of it, even though he has only been a cat for a few days. Ten minutes later we have an octopus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, so if I was petting Frumpkin when you were doing that, would he slowly lose his fur and grow tentacles, or would it be a poof?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll try that sometime, okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you hoping for that Ladyhawke moment where you have a furry octopus?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A furry octopus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One pat of just (growling noise).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a moment of transition. It's a little awkward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (yowling, then slurping)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sploosh) Into the ocean!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There you go, bud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (swishing) Below, disappearing into the depths.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. Go, Frumpkin, go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Come on, Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh! It's never good!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the upper tier of the water, Frumpkin sees-- the water here is pretty clear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He made it worse. The water here is pretty clear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin is a bit distracted by the heavy schools of fish that seem to be glittering beneath the surface and catching a little bit of the light that's making its way through the waves and causing this array of sparkles roughly 30, 40, 50 feet below the surface.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I see a whole lot of ocean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continues deeper, deeper. Make another perception check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. First thing Frumpkin notices is the ocean here is not as deep as the Diver's Grave. It goes down maybe 300 feet. It's still deep, but it's a third of the depth you ended up having to go down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to send him in slowly larger circles over time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin does see a shape amongst the clusters of seaweed and other bits of life that exist down there in natural ocean life. You can see chunks of ocean rock and volcanic rock, things that may have been lobbed from ancient volcanic detonations, and a tower; a sub-ocean tower that's leaning at an angle. You can see bits of broken rock based around it, and the seaweed is cluttered up around the base of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now are we talking architecture or natural?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Architecture, constructed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I relay this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The top of it is somewhat jagged; it has sustained some erosion or damage towards its top, and it leads down inside. You can see shelves or bits where there may have been stairs or levels, but most of that has fallen inward, and from Frumpkin's exterior perspective, mostly hollow and disappearing into darkness the further in. With a 14, Frumpkin also notices a little bit of movement. Towards the very tops of the seaweed, there are humanoid bodies that are tangled in the seaweed a bit that appear to be floating there, and then one of them twitches and goes (moaning).

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does this keep happening?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's more dead things down below.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nopey nope!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, Caduceus, you're definitely coming.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we may need a nap before we go down there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did; we got a long rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We just woke up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But, since the Yasha thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we still got a long rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, in that case, I'm going to manage my spells then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jagged tower seem familiar?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One thing we should do: can I get you guys to scurry up to the crow's nest one more time and give a gander for any ships?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me and Caduceus again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Look really carefully: coves, inlets, anything that might look like it might be hiding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Want to do separate rolls this time?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, let's do it separately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking horrible!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Totally fine! We're safe!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems pretty clear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seems pretty clear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That tower's familiar to you, huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. It just seems like the obvious entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you misspoke?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (background music)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, my impulsiveness was starting to catch up again. I just want to be honest. (sighs) Doesn't seem like there's a trap, Nott, right? We seem to be by ourselves, at least up here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but I mean, what's a couple of dead bodies on seaweed to people like us? No bigs, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, they're already dead? They're animated dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They were like (menacing noises).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fumpkin didn't get a great look at them. It was uncertain one or the other, but they appear to be humanoid and wrapped in seaweed, and then--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of them seemed to spasm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them seemed to twitch and move for a second before going back to rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: About what time of the day is it right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, it's early afternoon. Maybe one or two hours after noon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get this thing done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have the ability to let us breathe under there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yasha, how are you feeling?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Up for another scrap?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love swimming. I like scrapping. So this is a combo of the two of them, you know? I'm in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I'll look at the group and I will cast Underwater Breathing on everyone for 24 hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A familiar lightness in the lungs seems to take root inside. The air tastes a little bit different once the incantation is complete. You feel the familiar point of anxiety build in your chest since last time you dove.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's cold already. (groaning)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go find the other bottle of mead. Drink until I am more than intoxicated--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (yelling) That was for the crew!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck them!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?! Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need this right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your flask is bottomless!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm kind of sick of it; it's the same booze over and over again. I'm sorry-- I love you baby, I love you, but it's getting to be a little bit-- ugh. It's like if you eat Rice Krispies every day--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe if you washed it every now and then it would have a slightly different--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we see her go and sneak the mead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see her leave for a bit, and then come back with an empty bottle of mead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (slurring) Let's go swimming.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the distance from the middle of this archipelago to the nearest outer island?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About a quarter mile. A quarter mile to a mile to the nearest one. Actually, it's probably a little more than that, a few miles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go to Orly and say: While we're underneath, if you see another ship enter, or danger present itself, make for land and we'll find you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Understood." Yeah, it's about a mile to the shore, looking at the map there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should be fine, we'll find them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ready?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we go, I'm going to pull Caleb aside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all going to stare at you while you do this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, while we're down there, if Fjord tries to be, like, bad, can you restrain him? Like if something overcomes him with evil, can you fuck him up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Most likely, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would be ready to. I feel like 50-50 he's turning evil on us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Will you stay close to me down there, please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I meant physically. Physically, you're puny and weak. Intellectually, you're a rock star, you're amazing. You know I respect you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your first statement was accurate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, what did we get? The books? Did we get any good spells?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell me!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's food.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tapioca, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It lasts a long time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just food?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Any sort of--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The ink is good; it will help me in my studies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And the books, any powerful spells? Anything that can--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of the books was about debate. One was a spell book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's useful things in it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reality shifting things?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A little, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excellent. I give him a big kiss on his cheek, and it's real smelly. Me, not him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Both.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The book was about debate and then you were going to argue about--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull her even a little further away and turn our backs to the group and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all watching you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fine. I've been getting a little wrapped up in this team; we're working as a team, and I've forgotten you and me. I've forgotten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, don't! We're in this together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't forget me. I won't forget you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stay close.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Always. All right, fuckers, let's go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we get under, make sure to take a breath really quick; you'll sink faster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If Uk'otoa decides to show up--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He won't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But if he does--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He won't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (doubtfully) Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb is standing behind Beauregard and sliding his octopus onto his head.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Looking good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (heavy footsteps, splash)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No fear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: SEALs dive!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One by one, you all make your way into the ocean. (splashing) The water is cold, but you adjust and begin to find your way down. Are we swimming stealthily, or are we brazenly heading towards this temple?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Always stealthily.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so we're stealth missioning in. I need everybody to go ahead and make a stealth check, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20! Straight up, light up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is anybody putting some juice on this? No? Straight roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, straight roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I'll give you a Blessing of the Trickster.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks. That's plus ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, they're both good. Now even better. 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super middle of the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're moving at a slower speed, swimming below, trying to be as stealthy as you can. Making your way further down, the filtering light grows dimmer and dimmer--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I left the weasel on the ship again. I didn't bring him with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a certain point where I assume you're not trying to kill your weasel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not going to kill my weasel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I fucked with you for a few weeks when you were new to pet ownership, but then after a few close calls, I figured-- The deeper it goes, the harder it is to see, the colder it is-- a familiar sensation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it as dark as it was before? Equally?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's clear water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Regular seaweed, not the strange crimson type that you came across in the Diver's Grave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do a little ping of Eyes of the Grave, just to make sure there's no more of them in this other than the ones we can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the range on that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You're going to have to get pretty close to try it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know that we're heading-- once I feel like, or maybe I should hit it again--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you swim down to get within range to use your Eyes of the Grave, thankfully, the nearest creature doesn't seem to notice your approach. It is not undead. Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on. Ah, better. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, roll at disadvantage because you don't have darkvision, unfortunately, and you're low enough now where the light is limited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16's still okay. Now that you have a better look at it, at a closer perspective, the humanoid creature-- no clothing. It is thin.
